data.description: Advanced readings in primary and secondary literature of the history of the 16th-17th century European science, with emphasis on current historiographic issues.
data.title: STUDIES IN EARLY MODERN SCIENCE

data.description: An introduction to the formative period of modern science, including major ideas and events in the physical and life sciences from Copernicus to Newton.
data.title: THE SCIENTIFIC REVOLUTION: FROM COPERNICUS TO NEWTON

data.description: Emergence of scientific method and scientific modes of thought out of ancient philosophical and religious traditions; the impact of ancient science on medieval Christendom; the origins and development of the Copernican-Newtonian world view.
data.title: THE ORIGINS OF SCIENTIFIC THOUGHT

data.description: Western science and technology in the making. Major developments viewed in philosophical and social context, from antiquity to 17th century.
data.title: WESTERN CULTURE: SCIENCE, TECHNOLOGY, PHILOSOPHY I
